children: “We Can’t Stop” was the first single from Miley Cyrus' 2013 album
, and as such, many people’s first taste of the bolder Miley we now know.

, “We Can’t Stop” is about partying and having a good time. Unlike “Party in the USA”, “We Can’t Stop” is a slower, more bittersweet track, with a little language (the only swear word here used is “hell”), a little sex, and a few drug references. (The producer

Distancing yourself from Disney takes some work, but this is the moment Miley’s due diligence began in earnest. This track is rife with hip-hop references—part of Miley’s move towards an edgier, new sound.
The song peaked at #2 on the Billboard Hot 100.
